titleInfo.title: Le Caire Fête du tapis sacré

mods.abstract: Holy carpet of Mecca pilgrims in Cairo; Hand colored image of the procession of the Festival of Mah'mal, a pyramidal form hung by embroidered fabrics to be placed in the most sacred interior of the Mosque at Mecca (background); an armed guard on white horses lead the procession (foreground); Egyptian men and contemporary buildings frame the scene; "LE CAIRE. Fête du tapis sacre. Lichtenstern et Harari, Cairo" in gold along bottom of print.

titleInfo.title: Nineteenth and Early Twentieth Century Images of Egypt

location.physicalLocation: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture
